title.native: 空の境界 俯瞰風景
title.english: the Garden of sinners Chapter 1: Thanatos. (Overlooking View)

description:
September, 1998: In the city where Shiki lives, something triggers a spate of mysterious schoolgirl suicides. The connection between the girls who've leapt to their deaths is unclear, although all of them have jumped from the Fujou Building, a skyscraper scheduled to be demolished.

(Source: Aniplex USA)

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Ghost
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a ghost.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Achronological Order
tags.description: Chapters or episodes do not occur in chronological order.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Assassins
tags.description: Centers around characters who murder people as a profession.

title.native: 空の境界 殺人考察(前)
カーニバル・ファンタズム
空の境界 Remix -Gate of seventh heaven-
空の境界 the Garden of sinners

node.description:
__Headquarters:__ Tokyo, Japan

__[Website](http://typemoon.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/tmitterofficial)__

__Introduction:__
Type-Moon is a Japanese game company was founded by artist [Takashi Takeuchi](https://anilist.co/staff/99054/Takashi-Takeuchi) and writer [Kinoko Nasu](https://anilist.co/staff/98250/Kinoko-Nasu), who were also schoolmates. The names "TYPE-MOON" and "Notes." come from one of their early works, Notes..

__History:__
Originally formed as a Doujin Soft in 2000 and created the popular visual novel Tsukihime, but turned into a Commercial Organization on January 30, 2004 and in the same year, they released their PC-based eroge visual novel game Fate/stay night, which is their most well known title.

__[The BAMBOO BROOM (Blog)](http://www.remus.dti.ne.jp/~takeucto/)__

A Japanese author best known for writing the visual novels Tsukihime and Fate/stay night. Renowned for a unique style of storytelling and prose, Nasu is amongst the most prominent visual novelists in Japan. 

Together with high school classmate and friend, [Takeuchi Takashi](https://anilist.co/staff/99054/Takashi-Takeuchi), Nasu formed [TYPE-MOON](https://anilist.co/staff/97582) in 2000, originally as a doujin group to create the visual novel Tsukihime. It soon gained immense popularity, much of which is attributed to Nasu's unique style of storytelling. A sequel to Tsukihime, Kagetsu Tohya, was released on August 2001. 

54563 Kinokonasu is named after him

__[The BAMBOO BROOM (Blog)](http://www.remus.dti.ne.jp/~takeucto/)__

Takashi Takeuchi is a Japanese artist, noted as the co-founder of Japanese visual novel and anime development and production enterprise [TYPE-MOON](https://anilist.co/staff/97582), and for his illustrations on TYPE-MOON's visual novels, Tsukihime and Fate/stay night.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Fion0806) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100001583365922) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/0BLHMPWOZ2aTI0ZCCbtZem) | [Apple Music](https://music.apple.com/artist/yuki-kajiura/251013990) | [Deezer](https://www.deezer.com/artist/4663498)

Yuki Kajiura was born in Japan but raised in West Germany for most of her childhood. Her father was a big fan of classical and opera music and always desired for Yuki to play the piano for him. Yuki eventually gained a love for music and a love for the piano. Yuki started out as an SE programmer, but changed to music in 1992. She made her grand debut with a female trio called "[See-Saw](https://anilist.co/staff/104342)."  In the years to come the group released six singles and two albums. 

Yuki then went on to work on her solo career composing for artists and some TV, films, and games, such as _Blood: The Last Vampire_ in 2001, and _Xenosaga II_ and _III_. In 2001, Yuki's claim to fame came with the release of the anime [_NOIR_](https://anilist.co/anime/272). The soundtrack sold 50,000 copies. In 2002, she was brought on to project .hack to write the score to [_.hack//SIGN_](https://anilist.co/anime/48), along with vocalist [Chiaki Ishikawa](https://anilist.co/staff/101059) and New York singer [Emily Bindiger](https://anilist.co/staff/103845). Shortly after Yuki comprised an album of original and complied songs known as Fiction, working again with Emily Bindiger as well as _Xenosaga_ vocalist Deb Lyons.  

Yuki's other well-known works were for [_Mobile Suite Gundam Seed_](https://anilist.co/anime/93), which hit 5th on the Oricon Charts its first week, and selling over 200,000 copies. Yuki has also become known for her work on CLAMP's [_Tsubasa Chronicle_](https://anilist.co/anime/177) series, [movie](https://anilist.co/anime/807), and [OVAs](https://anilist.co/anime/2685). In 2003, she formed the project [FictionJunction](https://anilist.co/staff/103691) in which pairs Yuki's songwriting and composition with different performing vocalists, first as separate solo works and later into a singular group. In 2007, Yuki formed the band [Kalafina](https://anilist.co/staff/101975), with two partners from FictionJunction, Wakana Ootaki and [Keiko Kubota](https://anilist.co/staff/104664), to perform for the anime [_Kara no Kyoukai_](https://anilist.co/anime/2593), further working on several others. Kalafina disbanded in 2018, with their final lineup including Wakana, Keiko, and [Hikaru](https://anilist.co/staff/168857).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Fion0806) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100001583365922) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/0BLHMPWOZ2aTI0ZCCbtZem) | [Apple Music](https://music.apple.com/artist/yuki-kajiura/251013990) | [Deezer](https://www.deezer.com/artist/4663498)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Fion0806) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100001583365922) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/0BLHMPWOZ2aTI0ZCCbtZem) | [Apple Music](https://music.apple.com/artist/yuki-kajiura/251013990) | [Deezer](https://www.deezer.com/artist/4663498)

Kalafina disbanded in 2018, with their final lineup including Wakana, Keiko, and [Hikaru](https://anilist.co/staff/168857).

[Official Website](http://www.kalafina.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kalafina_staff) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCnRbD__LEKBj_ZR_dC8KmzQ)

Kalafina were a Japanese band formed by composer [Yuki Kajiura](https://anilist.co/staff/100077/Yuki-Kajiura) in 2007 to mainly perform theme songs for the [Kara no Kyoukai](https://anilist.co/anime/2593/Kara-no-Kyoukai-Fukan-Fuukei/) anime movies, but since expanded to many other theme songs for other anime shows and films.

Main vocals and backgrounds are provided by a different member each time. For example, Wakana is in charge of the main vocals in Oblivious and Lacrimosa, while the main vocals in Aria are done by Hikaru. In others songs each of them sings a stanza. Wakana and Keiko are also members of Yuki Kajiura's [FictionJunction](https://anilist.co/staff/103691/FictionJunction) project. 

Spacecraft agency officially announced disbandment on March 13, 2019 after Kajiura, Keiko, and Hikaru left the agency in 2018.

In January 2025, the three members will reunite for the first time in six years to hold "Kalafina Anniversary LIVE 2025" at the Tokyo Garden Theater, with Takebe Satoshi serving as musical director.

__Members:__
• [Yuki Kajiura](https://anilist.co/staff/100077/) (梶浦由記) - Composer

• Keiko - [Keiko Kubota](https://anilist.co/staff/104664/) (窪田啓子/ケイコ) - Vocalist
• Wakana - Wakana Ootaki (大滝若奈/ワカナ) - Vocalist
• Hikaru - [Hikaru Masai](https://anilist.co/staff/168857/) (政井光/ヒカル) - Vocalist

• Maya Toyoshima (豊島摩耶) - Vocalist, participated only in "ARIA"/"sprinter", left the group in 2009

__Support:__
• Remi Tanaka (田中玲美/REMI) - Background vocalist
• [Yuriko Kaida](https://anilist.co/staff/103489/) (貝田由里子) - Background vocalist
• Hanae Tomaru (戸丸華江) - Background vocalist

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hikaruufo) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/近藤光)

Founder and representative director of [ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/). Animation producer, sound director and music director for almost every ufotable production. He's also one of the scriptwriters in the studio.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/高橋タクロヲ)

Originating from [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/). Currently affiliated with [Ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/高橋タクロヲ)

Originating from [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/). Currently affiliated with [Ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ei_aoki)

Ei Aoki is a Japanese storyboard artist and director. He credits the anime Megazone 23 as his inspiration to have a career in animation. In 2013, he created the animation studio Troyca with Toshiyuki Nagano and Tomonobu Kato, which began animation production on its first work in the fall of 2014.
Representative director of [Aniplex](https://anilist.co/studio/17/). Board Director at [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks).

Originating from Studio Boomerang, currently affiliated with [ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/). 

His role as a main animator on [Ikki Tousen: Dragon Destiny](https://anilist.co/anime/1956/) attracted a lot of attention. At ufotable he is one of the studio's key members among people like [Akira Matsushima](https://anilist.co/staff/119808/), [Masayuki Kunihiro](https://anilist.co/staff/146702/) and [Masaru Kimura](https://anilist.co/staff/146698/).

Held in high regard by [Yasuomi Umetsu](https://anilist.co/staff/101583/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/須藤友徳)

Affiliated with [ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/). Noted for his layouting skills.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/須藤友徳)

Affiliated with [ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/). Noted for his layouting skills.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/matagadaisuke33)
Affiliated with Space Craft Produce and Yuki Kajiura's agent.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mastin55) | [Website](http://masuhoga.jp/)
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/岩浪美和) | [Twitter](https://x.com/i/user/169097071)
Married to [Takayuki Hirao](https://anilist.co/staff/102247/).
